content.text: As a client, I want to have our organization’s fiscal year in the HR Danbi system. This will allow me to align the system with our organization's financial calendar.
The start date for the fiscal year should be set to 07/01.
The end date for the fiscal year should be set to 06/30.

fields.summary: Setting Fiscal Year in the System

issuetype.description: Stories track functionality or features expressed as user goals.
issuetype.name: US

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

content.text: As a client, I want the time-off balance start date for each employee to be aligned with their employment start date. This ensures that each full-time employee's paid time-off (PTO) period begins on their first day of employment.
Default setting: For each full-time employee, the system should automatically set the time-off balance start date to be the same as their employment start date.
The default setting should apply to all new full-time employees added to the system.
Client Admin can manually adjust the time-off balance start date for individual employees. This will override the default setting.

fields.summary: Setting Time-Off Balance Start Date for Employees

issuetype.description: Stories track functionality or features expressed as user goals.
issuetype.name: US

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

content.text: As a client, I want the ability to set distinct time-off policies for various time-off types. This ensures flexibility in managing accrued and lump-sum time-off for different categories.
To be determined - prerequisite: 12 month of work-time (perhaps Client Admin puts a check mark in employee setting for eligiblity)
** Note: Currently, the client is doing accrual based on # of days. The client is considering to change this to paycheck periods. The client has two pay check periods: monthly and semi-monthly.

fields.summary: Configuring Time-Off Policies for Different Time-Off Types

issuetype.description: Stories track functionality or features expressed as user goals.
issuetype.name: US

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

content.text: As a client admin, I want the ability to set specific carry-over rules for remaining time-off days for different time-off types. This allows for fine-tuned control over how unused time-off balances are handled.
Yes. The maximum accumulation is 60 days.
** Supervisor’s approval part will be handled in a future story.

content.text: As a client admin, I want the organization’s holiday calendars recorded n the HR Danbi system. This ensures that time-off requests from employees are recorded accurately, taking into account designated holidays.

Won Buddhism Founder's Day (April 28, if April 28 falls on a Saturday, the previous Friday will constitute the holiday, If April 28 falls on a Sunday, the following Monday will constitute the holiday)
Thanksgiving Day and the day after Thanksgiving

content.text: As a client admin, I want to streamline the account setup process for employees by implementing Single Sign-On (SSO) using the organization's Google account. This will eliminate needs for managing separate accounts while ensuring a seamless onboarding process.

content.text: As a client admin, I want approved time-offs to be automatically synchronized and appear on the employee's Google Calendar. This integration will enhance visibility and help employees manage their schedules more effectively.
When a time-off request is approved, the corresponding entry should be automatically added to the employee’s Google Calendar.
“Approved on “ & [TO approved time and date] & “by “ & [approver’s name] & “ for ” & [time-off day(s) or hour(s)] & “of “ & [time-off type]
Approved on 3:15 PM on Wednesday, January 31 by Harvey Oh for 1 day of Personal Leave.

fields.summary: [Placeholder] Automatic Time-Off Integration with Google Calendar

content.text: As a client admin, I want the ability to schedule recurring reminder emails on HR Danbi to be sent to Timesheet users, prompting them to submit their timesheets. I would like a simple interface to set up and manage the reminder schedule rules.
The system should provide a user-friendly interface for client admins to configure and manage reminder rules
Client admins should be able to set the frequency and recurrence of the reminder emails (e.g., every 10th, every Wednesdays, bi-weekly, etc)
Once configured, the system should automatically send out the reminder emails based on the specified recurrence and user selection
For testing, the email subject says “HR Danbi - Timesheet Reminder” and the body say “test”
The ability to customize the email subject and body will be discussed later.

fields.summary: [Placeholder] Configuring Recurring Timesheet Submission Reminder Emails
